tit.cmt: sect 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 慶円（けいえん/きょうえん・慶圓、天慶7年（944年） - 寛仁3年9月3日 (旧暦)（1019年10月3日））は、平安時代中期の天台宗僧侶。
sen.e: Keien (Kyoen, 944 - 3 March 1019) is a Buddhist monk of mid Heian period.
Keien (Kyoen, 944 - 3 March 1019) is a Buddhist monk of mid Heian period.
Keien (Kyoen, 944 - October 9, 1019) is a Buddhist priest of the Tendai sect during the mid Heian period.
sen.cmt: 月日を修正しました。Monk→ priest と統一しました。

sen.j: 天台座主を務めた。
sen.e: He served as Tendai Zasu (the highest post of Tendai Sect).
He served as Tendai Zasu (the highest post of Tendai Sect).
He served as Tendai-zasu (the highest post of Tendai sect).

sen.j: 「三昧座主」と称された。
sen.e: He was called "Zanmai Zasu".
He was called "Zanmai Zasu".
He was called 'Zanmai-zasu.'

sen.j: 播磨国国司藤原尹文の子で藤原実資の母方の叔父とされている。
sen.e: He is said to be a son of FUJIWARA no Masabumi, Kokushi (provincial governor) of Harima Province and a maternal uncle of FUJIWARA no Sanesuke.
He is said to be a son of FUJIWARA no Masabumi, Kokushi (provincial governor) of Harima Province and a maternal uncle of FUJIWARA no Sanesuke.
He is said to be a son of FUJIWARA no Masabumi, Kokushi (provincial governor) of Harima Province and a maternal uncle of FUJIWARA no Sanesuke.

sen.j: 他にも尹文の父である大納言藤原道明の子説や尾張国守藤原連貞の子説などがある。
sen.e: He is also said to be a son of FUJIWARA no Michiakira, father of Masabumi, or a son of FUJIWARA no Tsurasada, Owari no kuni no kami (governor of Owari Province).
He is also said to be a son of FUJIWARA no Michiakira, father of Masabumi, or a son of FUJIWARA no Tsurasada, Owari no kuni no kami (governor of Owari Province).
He is also said to be a son of Dainagon (chief councilor of state) FUJIWARA no Michiakira, father of Masabumi, or a son of FUJIWARA no Tsurasada, Owari no kuni no kami (governor of Owari Province).
sen.cmt: 大納言 を追加しました。

sen.j: 幼くして延暦寺に入り、喜慶に師事する。
sen.e: He entered Enryaku-ji Temple when he was small and studied under Kikei.
He entered Enryaku-ji Temple when he was small and studied under Kikei.
He entered Enryaku-ji Temple when he was small and studied under Kikei.

sen.j: 天暦8年（954年）に得度受戒を受ける。
sen.e: He entered the Buddhist priesthood (tokudo) and received religious percepts (jukai) in 954.
He entered the Buddhist priesthood (tokudo) and received religious percepts (jukai) in 954.
He entered the Buddhist priesthood (tokudo) and received religious percepts (jukai) in 954.

sen.j: 康保元年9月15日 (旧暦)（964年）の勧学会に参加、長徳元年（995年）に内供としての功績が評価されて権律師に任ぜられる。
sen.e: He participated Kangakukai (study session) on 15 September 964, and was appointed Gon no Risshi (a provisional rank in the lowest managerial position) in 995, recognized his achievements as naigu (same as naigubu, a monk serving at the court chapel).

He participated Kangakukai (study session) on 15 September 964, and was appointed Gon no Risshi (a provisional rank in the lowest managerial position) in 995, recognized his achievements as naigu (same as naigubu, a monk serving at the court chapel).

He participated Kangakukai (study session) on October 27, 964, and was appointed Gon no Risshi (a provisional rank in the lowest managerial position) in 995, after being recognized his achievements as naigu (a priest serving at the Imperial Court).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 長保2年（1000年）に権少僧都、2年後に大僧都に任ぜられる。
sen.e: Then he was appointed Gon no Shozozu (a provisional junior rank in the second highest managerial position) in 1000, and two years later Daisozu (the upper Buddhist priest in the second highest position).
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・大僧都の定訳はカッコ内が「priests」となっていますが、文脈から単数形としました。
sen.e: Then he was appointed Gon no Shozozu (a provisional junior rank in the second highest managerial position) in 1000, and two years later Daisozu (the upper Buddhist priest in the second highest position).

Then he was appointed Gon no Shozozu (a provisional junior rank in the second highest managerial position) in 1000, and two years later Daisozu (the highest grade that can be held by one who has reached the second highest rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests).
sen.cmt: 大僧都 補足を修正しました。

sen.j: 寛弘8年（1011年）権僧正に任じられ、長和2年（1013年）1月14日 (旧暦)に僧正、12月26日 (旧暦)に大僧正に任じられる。
sen.e: He was appointed Gon no Sojo (the provisional lower priest in the highest position) in 1011, Sojo (a priest ranked in the highest managerial position) on 14 January 1013, then Daisojo on 26 December.
He was appointed Gon no Sojo (the provisional lower priest in the highest position) in 1011, Sojo (a priest ranked in the highest managerial position) on 14 January 1013, then Daisojo on 26 December.

He was appointed Gon no Sojo (the provisional lower priest in the highest position) in 1011, Sojo (a priest ranked in the highest managerial position) on March 4, 1013, then Daisojo (a priest of the highest rank in the highest managerial position) on February 4, 1014.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 翌長和3年（1014年）12月26日に第24代天台座主に補される。
sen.e: He was appointed the twenty-fourth Tendai Zasu on 26 December 1014.
He was appointed the twenty-fourth Tendai Zasu on 26 December 1014.
He was appointed the 24th Tendai-zasu on January 25, 1015.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: また、法性寺座主・普門院別当なども務めた。
sen.e: He also served as zasu (a head priest of a temple) of Hossho-ji Temple and betto (administrator of a Buddhist temple) of Fumon-in Temple.
He also served as zasu (a head priest of a temple) of Hossho-ji Temple and betto (administrator of a Buddhist temple) of Fumon-in Temple.
He also served as zasu (a head priest of a temple) of Hossho-ji Temple and betto (administrator of a Buddhist temple) of Fumon-in Temple.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: 寛仁3年（1019年）8月13日 (旧暦)に病気を理由に大僧正を辞任、9月3日に没する。
sen.e: On 13 August 1019 he retired from Daisojo because of ill and passed away on 3 September.
On 13 August 1019 he retired from Daisojo because of ill and passed away on 3 September.
On September 20, 1019 he retired from Daisojo because of ill and passed away on October 9.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 甥とされる藤原実資は「堪能人也」と評価して青年時代から慶円の元をしばしば訪れて庶子良円 (天台宗)を託した。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Sanesuke who is said to be Keien's nephew appreciated Keien as "a skillful man" and frequently visited Keien from when he was young and left Ryoen (Tendai Sect), his child born out of wedlock, to Keien's care.

FUJIWARA no Sanesuke who is said to be Keien's nephew appreciated Keien as "a skillful man" and frequently visited Keien from when he was young and left Ryoen (Tendai Sect), his child born out of wedlock, to Keien's care.

sen.j: 死の間際の8月23日には牛乳の服用を勧めるなど生涯にわたって崇敬しており、彼の日記『小右記』には慶円の記事が多数見られる。
sen.e: As he recommended Keien to drink milk on 23 August just before Keien died, he respected Keien throughout his life, and many references to Keien are found in his diary "Shoyuki".
As he recommended Keien to drink milk on 23 August just before Keien died, he respected Keien throughout his life, and many references to Keien are found in his diary "Shoyuki".
As he recommended Keien to drink milk on September 10 just before Keien died, he respected Keien throughout his life, and many references to Keien are found in his diary "Shoyuki."
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: また、藤原行成も慶円と親交が厚く、日記『権記』にも慶円の記事が登場する。
sen.e: Also Keien was on close terms with FUJIWARA no Yukinari and he is referred to in "Gonki" (Yukinari's diary).
sen.cmt: 『権記』定訳のカッコ書きから、文脈により"FUJIWARA no"を省きました。
sen.e: Also Keien was on close terms with FUJIWARA no Yukinari and he is referred to in "Gonki" (Yukinari's diary).

sen.j: 更に一条天皇も長保5年（1003年）に当時4歳の媄子内親王の鼻の中に雙六のさいころが嵌る事故が発生した際に加持を行ってさいころを取り出し褒美を与えたことが『百練抄』に記されている。
sen.e: Furthermore, it is stated in "Hyakurensho" (a record of the Kamakura period) that in 1003 the Emperor Ichijo gave award to Keien when a dice for sugoroku (dice game) got into the nose of Imperial Princess Bishi who was four years old at that time and Keien did incantation to take it out.

Furthermore, it is stated in "Hyakurensho" (a record of the Kamakura period) that in 1003 the Emperor Ichijo gave award to Keien when a dice for sugoroku (dice game) got into the nose of Imperial Princess Bishi who was four years old at that time and Keien did incantation to take it out.

Furthermore, it is stated in "Hyakurensho" (a record of the Kamakura period) that in 1003 the Emperor Ichijo gave award to Keien when a dice for sugoroku (dice game) got into the nose of Imperial Princess Bishi who was four years old at that time and Keien did incantation to take it out.

sen.j: 寛弘8年（1011年）に一条上皇が崩御直前に出家した際の戒師を務め、崩御の直前慶円の加持によって一時的に蘇生したことが上皇の崩御を看取った藤原行成が証言している（『権記』）。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Yukinari who attended deathbed of the Retired Emperor Ichijo testifies that Keien was served as kaishi (the priest who imparts the Buddhist commandments) in 1011 when the Retired Emperor Ichijo entered into priesthood just before his death and Keien's incantation temporarily revived the Retired Emperor at the last minute of his life ("Gonki").

FUJIWARA no Yukinari who attended deathbed of the Retired Emperor Ichijo testifies that Keien was served as kaishi (the priest who imparts the Buddhist commandments) in 1011 when the Retired Emperor Ichijo entered into priesthood just before his death and Keien's incantation temporarily revived the Retired Emperor at the last minute of his life ("Gonki").

sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: ところが、当時の最大の権力者であった藤原道長とは不仲で、道長の日記『御堂関白記』には慶円が道長を「如讎敵」と見ていることが記されている。
sen.e: On the other hand, Keien was on bad terms with FUJIWARA no Michinaga who was most powerful at that time, and it is stated in "Mido Kanpakuki (diary of FUJIWARA no Michinaga)" that Keien regarded Michinaga as "like an enemy".
sen.cmt: 「如讎敵」は読み方・定訳不明ですが、如＝ごとし、讎＝かたき、敵＝てき、という各字の意味を英訳しました。
sen.e: On the other hand, Keien was on bad terms with FUJIWARA no Michinaga who was most powerful at that time, and it is stated in "Mido Kanpakuki (diary of FUJIWARA no Michinaga)" that Keien regarded Michinaga as "like an enemy".

On the other hand, Keien was on bad terms with FUJIWARA no Michinaga who was most powerful at that time, and it is stated in "Mido Kanpakuki" (diary of FUJIWARA no Michinaga) that Keien regarded Michinaga as 'like an enemy.'

sen.j: 道長と慶円は当初の関係は良好であった。
sen.e: Michinaga and Keien were on familiar terms in the beginning.
Michinaga and Keien were on familiar terms in the beginning.
Michinaga and Keien were on familiar terms in the beginning.

sen.j: しかし、長和元年（1012年）に道長が出家した息子藤原顕信の受戒のために比叡山に馬で登ったことに延暦寺の僧侶・大衆が反発し、直後に道長が病気になった際に慶円がそのことに抗議して加持祈祷の修法を拒んだ。
sen.e: However, in 1012 Michinaga's climbing Hiei-zan Mountain on the horse caused resentment among Buddhist monks and the mass of people, and just after that Keien refused to do Shuho (an esoteric ritual) of incantation and prayer in resistance.

However, in 1012 Michinaga's climbing Hiei-zan Mountain on the horse caused resentment among Buddhist monks and the mass of people, and just after that Keien refused to do Shuho (an esoteric ritual) of incantation and prayer in resistance.

However, in 1012 Michinaga's climbing Mt. Hiei on the horse caused resentment among Buddhist priests and the mass of people, and just after that Keien refused to do Shuho (an esoteric ritual) of incantation and prayer in resistance when Michinaga became sick.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を追加しました。Monk→ priest と統一しました。

sen.j: そのことが（不仲の）原因であったとされている。
sen.e: This is said to be the cause of their discord.
This is said to be the cause of their discord.
This is said to be the cause of their discord.

sen.j: その後も慶円は三条天皇の病気回復のために祈祷するなど道長の権勢におもねらない姿勢を示した。
sen.e: Thereafter Keien showed his attitude not to fawn upon Michinaga's power by for example praying for recovery of Emperor Sanjo.
Thereafter Keien showed his attitude not to fawn upon Michinaga's power by for example praying for recovery of Emperor Sanjo.
Thereafter Keien showed his attitude not to fawn upon Michinaga's power by for example praying for recovery of Emperor Sanjo.

sen.j: しかし、道長の外孫である後一条天皇及び敦良親王の病気回復の際に修法を行って以後は両者和解の方向に向かったという。
sen.e: But after Keien did Shuho for recovery of Emperor Goichijo and Imperial Prince Atsunaga who were grandchildren from Michinaga's daughter married into another family, they are said to have started to reconcile.
